alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scotts Bluff, west central Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Bayard Junction, or 20 miles southeast of Scottsbluff. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bayard, Minatare, Chimney Rock State Park, Moomaws Corner, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62, South Bayard Junction, Melbeta and McGrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
